name: Higger Tor & Carl Wark Circuit
summary: A short but spectacular circuit visiting the rocky summit of Higger Tor and the ancient hillfort of Carl Wark.
terrain: Stone-flagged paths, rocky steps, short steep climbs, open moorland.

ai.summary: A scenic moderate circular hike in the Peak District that links the Higger Tor and Carl Wark tors. The route traverses open moorland and rocky outcrops, rewarding walkers with expansive views over Derbyshire. Distance is not specified here, but expect a moderate-length circuit with some ascent to both tors.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly moorland paths and rocky trails with uneven surfaces. The route includes climbs to Higger Tor and the approach to Carl Wark, plus exposed stretches and potential mud after rain. Wear sturdy footwear and be prepared for variable ground and weather.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go; the Peak District is exposed and conditions can change quickly. Stay on marked paths, watch for steep drops on tors, and keep children or dogs under control. Wear sturdy boots, bring layers and a waterproof jacket, carry a map or GPS, and have enough water and snacks. Let someone know your plan and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Emergency whistle and a small flashlight or headlamp
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly May–October) with drier, clearer conditions and better views; winter hikes are possible but require extra caution and warm clothing.
